prompts.Acetabular Loosening: The acetabular cup shows signs of loosening, demonstrated by radiolucent lines, migration, or changes at the bone–implant interface.
prompts.Dislocation: The prosthetic hip joint has lost congruency, resulting in dislocation of the hip prosthesis with the femoral head displaced out of the acetabular cup.
prompts.Fracture: There is discontinuity of the cortical bone surrounding the hip prosthesis with angulation or deformity, indicative of a periprosthetic fracture adjacent to the implant.
prompts.Good Place: A well-functioning hip prosthesis with symmetrical joint space and stable component fixation. The surrounding bone shows no signs of aggressive osteolysis, wear-induced scalloping, or particulate debris. Implant appears in a neutral, non-deforming position.
prompts.Infection: There is evidence of periprosthetic joint infection, suggested by findings such as irregular osteolysis, periosteal reaction, soft tissue swelling or fluid collections
prompts.Native Hip: This represents a native hip joint without prosthetic components, demonstrating normal osseous and joint anatomy.
prompts.Spacer: A temporary antibiotic spacer is present within the hip joint, typically used during staged revision arthroplasty to maintain space and deliver local antibiotics.
prompts.Stem Loosening: The femoral stem demonstrates signs of loosening, including radiolucent lines, subsidence, or migration along the bone–implant interface.
prompts.Wear: Wear debris is present around the prosthetic components, accompanied by adjacent bone resorption or asymmetric joint space narrowing consistent with prosthesis wear and potential osteolysis.

optimization_history.old_desc: The hip prosthesis is in an appropriate position with proper alignment and no evidence of loosening, migration, or malposition.
optimization_history.new_desc: A well-positioned hip prosthesis with smooth, well-defined margins. No irregular osteolysis, periosteal reaction, or soft tissue swelling. Cortical bone appears intact and stable around the implant.

optimization_history.old_desc: The hip prosthesis is in an appropriate position with proper alignment and no evidence of loosening, migration, or malposition.
optimization_history.new_desc: A stable hip prosthesis with normal alignment and clear, regular bone-prosthesis interfaces. The surrounding cortical bone is smooth and continuous, and adjacent soft tissues appear normal without swelling or fluid collections.

optimization_history.old_desc: The hip prosthesis is in an appropriate position with proper alignment and no evidence of loosening, migration, or malposition.
optimization_history.new_desc: Optimal prosthesis position with uniform, narrow lucency at the bone-cement interface. Bone margins are smooth and sclerotic, with no periosteal reaction, aggressive osteolysis, or soft tissue abnormalities.

optimization_history.old_desc: Optimal prosthesis position with uniform, narrow lucency at the bone-cement interface. Bone margins are smooth and sclerotic, with no periosteal reaction, aggressive osteolysis, or soft tissue abnormalities.
optimization_history.new_desc: A properly aligned hip prosthesis exhibiting a stable, non-progressive lucent line less than 2mm. There is no scalloping, periosteal new bone formation, or effusion. The surrounding bone appears normal.

optimization_history.old_desc: A properly aligned hip prosthesis exhibiting a stable, non-progressive lucent line less than 2mm. There is no scalloping, periosteal new bone formation, or effusion. The surrounding bone appears normal.
optimization_history.new_desc: Correctly positioned hip prosthesis. It shows a thin, uniform radiolucent line at the interface without expansion over time. The bone appears healthy with no signs of destruction, reactive new bone, or soft tissue inflammation.

optimization_history.old_desc: A properly aligned hip prosthesis exhibiting a stable, non-progressive lucent line less than 2mm. There is no scalloping, periosteal new bone formation, or effusion. The surrounding bone appears normal.
optimization_history.new_desc: A hip prosthesis demonstrating successful osseointegration with a stable bone-implant interface. There is no progressive osteolysis, periosteal elevation, or abnormal soft tissue density. The radiographic findings are consistent with a well-fixed, non-infected implant.

optimization_history.old_desc: A properly aligned hip prosthesis exhibiting a stable, non-progressive lucent line less than 2mm. There is no scalloping, periosteal new bone formation, or effusion. The surrounding bone appears normal.
optimization_history.new_desc: Well-fixed hip prosthesis in anatomical position. The bone-cement interface shows a thin, non-expanding lucency. There is absence of destructive osteolysis, periosteal reaction, or soft tissue swelling, which are all key negative findings against infection.

optimization_history.old_desc: Well-fixed hip prosthesis in anatomical position. The bone-cement interface shows a thin, non-expanding lucency. There is absence of destructive osteolysis, periosteal reaction, or soft tissue swelling, which are all key negative findings against infection.
optimization_history.new_desc: A well-positioned hip prosthesis with a stable bone-implant interface showing a uniform, non-progressive lucency. There is no asymmetric joint space narrowing, focal osteolysis, or radiographically evident wear debris. The periprosthetic bone appears normal.

optimization_history.old_desc: Well-fixed hip prosthesis in anatomical position. The bone-cement interface shows a thin, non-expanding lucency. There is absence of destructive osteolysis, periosteal reaction, or soft tissue swelling, which are all key negative findings against infection.
optimization_history.new_desc: A securely fixed hip prosthesis with normal component alignment and position. The joint space is symmetric and well-maintained, with no evidence of eccentric wear, particle disease, or focal osteolytic lesions.

optimization_history.old_desc: Well-fixed hip prosthesis in anatomical position. The bone-cement interface shows a thin, non-expanding lucency. There is absence of destructive osteolysis, periosteal reaction, or soft tissue swelling, which are all key negative findings against infection.
optimization_history.new_desc: A well-functioning hip prosthesis with symmetrical joint space and stable component fixation. The surrounding bone shows no signs of aggressive osteolysis, wear-induced scalloping, or particulate debris. Implant appears in a neutral, non-deforming position.
